intro: Hieracium tephrelytrum, commonly known as the tephrelytrum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically hairy stems. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, and is often found in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
